Event.description: Curious what’s been going on in the coffeehouses and dark alleys of tabletop roleplaying? Wondering what’s got those stodgy old dudes’ and self-appointed moral watchdogs’ knickers all bunched up? Just looking for something beyond “roll to hit, roll damage”? Join some enthusiastic long-timers for an off-the-record tour. We’ll show you what’s out there, why it’s cool, and how you can be part of it. Tell ‘em lumpley sent you. -- Panelists: Vincent Baker [owner/creator, lumpley games], Meguey Baker [owner/creator, Night Sky Games], Emily Care Boss [owner/creator, Black & Green Games], Epidiah Ravachol [owner/creator, Dig a Thousand Holes Publishing], Robert Bohl [owner/creator, Robert Bohl Games]
Event.name: An Inside Look at Indie RPGs

Event.description: As videogames become an international hobby, games increasingly run into problems of representation and localization. Military shooters often use international conflicts or real locations as their backdrop, igniting controversy in the countries they portray as well as raising questions about the portrayal of foreign people and the impact of violence in digital space. This panel will explore the more worrisome aspects of this trend and discuss possible solutions the industry can use going forward. -- Panelists: What’s the favorite game of Hezbollah militants? What are the ethical questions we need to consider when designing violent media? How’d Castro feel about getting shot in Black Ops? This sequel to PAX East’s “Borders, Bigotry, and Body Dumps” will take on Oliver North, The Red Cross, and whether Spec Ops: The Line represents a new breed of ethically-centered shooter.
Event.name: Borders and Bullets: Global Game Controversies

Event.description: Depression and anxiety rears its ugly head in many a gamer’s life. Join us, a panel of game designers and freelancers well acquainted with the subject. We’ll trade life stories and share advice on how to take back control of your lives. You aren’t alone, you have a whole gaming tribe that wants you to get better. -- Panelists: Philippe-Antoine Menard [Game Designer and Blogger, Critical-Hits LLC]
Event.name: Fighting your Inner-Demons: Gamers Dealing with Depression

Event.description: Should you let your six-year-old play Assassin’s Creed? What’s the best way to introduce your child to RPGs? How do you handle it when your kid doesn’t want to play a game because he thinks he’ll lose? What do you say if your son prefers J.K. Rowling to J.R.R. Tolkien, or if your daughter prefers “Enterprise” to “Deep Space Nine?” These questions and many more will be discussed by writers for GeekDad.com, GeekMom.com, and geek parents in the audience. Come share your stories and advice for how to ensure our kids grow up to be geeks like us! Don’t have kids? Show up and find out what may be in store for you if you ever do! -- Panelists: Matt Blum [Managing Editor, GeekDad.com], Corrina Lawson [Senior Editor, GeekMom.com], Jonathan Liu [Senior Editor, GeekDad.com], Curtis Silver [Core Contributor, GeekDad.com], Nicole Wakelin [Core Contributor, GeekMom.com], Doug Cornelius [Contributor, GeekDad.com], Ryan Carlson [Contributor, GeekDad.com]
Event.name: Geek Parenting

Event.description: Whatever happened to foreplay? People tend to talk (and program) a lot about sex in games and forget all about the delicious build up. But with growing female and non-traditional male consumer bases, game developers are starting to reach beyond the adolescent male fantasy. You can get hitched in Skyrim, have a steamy bath with your lady in Witcher 2, and woo a whole lot of different people in Mass Effect… and that’s just the tip of the iceberg. -- Panelists: Moderated by Fire Hose Games and When I Grow Up’s Sean Baptiste, writers Miellyn Fitzwater Barrows and Lacy Wilson from Tin Man Games’ romance gamebook series Strange Loves join the hosts of the Press2Reset Transmission Podcast Melissa Kay and Aenne Schumann and BioWare Event Consultant and Rated NA Podcast host Hilary Shapiro to draw back the covers on the sensual side of games and game culture.
Event.name: Foreplay: Romance in Games

Event.description: Bring your things! They will bring the signings! -- Panelists: Gabe and Tycho!
Event.name: Gabe and Tycho Signing

Event.description: Want to play a D&D game without a DM? Do you like cooperative games? How about head-to-head Euro-style games? Or casual dungeon delves? Come with your friends to play any of our D&D themed board games all weekend long! Stop in anytime to select from Dungeon, Castle Ravenloft, Wrath of Ashardalon, The Legend of Drizzt, or Lords of Waterdeep!
Event.name: D&D Board Game Open Play

Event.description: Bring your best Dungeon Command warband to compete in a four-round tournament, with the winner crowned PAX East champion! Build your warband containing exactly 12 Creatures with appropriate cards and miniatures, at least 30 Order cards (no more than 4 of any one Order card allowed), a Commander, and 4 battlefield tiles. The tournament is 4-5 hours long, free to enter, and prizes abound!
Event.name: Dungeon Command Constructed Tournament

Event.description: Do you take classes? Do you teach classes? Wouldn’t those classes be more exciting and engaging and memorable if they had some of the same alluring qualities of your favorite games? Concepts that have been mainstays of the gaming world for years, like leveling, achievements and non-linear progression, are just the beginning of exciting change in the world of education. -- Panelists: The gamification of education is going on right now and can be very effective, yet it is one of the most nascent and underdeveloped fronts in the world of gaming. Come to Education Gamification to see how these ideas are changing the way we learn, and to exchange best practices, ideas, and dreams on how gaming can make education more accessible to today’s students and teachers.
Event.name: Education Gamification

Event.description: Each player recieves 4 Gatecrash boosters, plays a 30 card deck
Event.name: Magic: The Gathering 4 Booster Sealed Deck

Event.description: Each player receives 1 booster each of Innistrad, Dark Ascension, Avacyn Restored,Magic 2013, Return to Ravinca and Gatecrash
Event.name: Magic: The Gathering Sealed Deck from Standard Boosters

Event.description: Do you think you know everything there is to know about Nintendo video games? Do you think you could totally become a Nintendoaire, if given the chance? Then get ready for Nintendo World Report’s “Who Wants To A Nintendoaire?” We’ll take as many contestants as we possibly can in an hour, and even let the audience participate, making everyone in the audience able to win a prize. If you enjoy Nintendo games, intense moments of human triumph or strife, and guerrilla reinterpretations of TV game shows, then you’ll want to see if you or one of your fellow PAX-goers becomes a Nintendoaire. -- Panelists: Neal Ronaghan [Director, Nintendo World Report], Scott Thompson [Podcast Editor, Nintendo World Report], Lauren Ronaghan [Contributing Writer, Nintendo World Report], Billy Brown [Contributor, Nintendo World Report], Patrick Barnett [News Editor, Nintendo World Report]
Event.name: Who Wants To Be A Nintendoaire?

Event.description: In this panel presented by Game Music Composer Matthew Pablo; attendees will be asked to participate by thinking of video game scenarios or concepts and as a group we will create the music for these ideas. We will see and experience process of composing music for games! Come and share your creativity! Musicians: Feel encouraged to participate in some of the recording/composition. This is also great panel for game producers and developers to attend as they will see the value in having someone create original music for your game. -- Panelists: Britany Hayes [Artist, Console Alliance], John M. O’Meara
Event.name: Let’s Make Video Game Music!

Event.description: You’ve got 45 seconds to deliver your idea to our panel of experts. The top three pitches will be picked for prizes and swag.
Event.name: Pitch Your Game Idea

Event.description: The Double Fine Adventure made headlines early this year with a $3.3 million dollar Kickstarter. Since then, the team at Double Fine has been hard at work on a brand new adventure game and 2 Player Productions has been right beside them to document the whole thing. Backers of the project have been given incredible insight into the game’s development, but little of this information has been shown to the general public. Join us for a screening of new highlights from the Double Fine Adventure documentary, immediately followed by a Q & A with Double Fine and 2 Player Productions. -- Panelists: Tim Schafer [President and CEO, Double Fine Productions], Greg Rice [Producer, Double Fine Adventure, Double Fine Productions], Paul Levering [Producer, 2 Player Productions], Chris Remo [Community Manager, Double Fine Productions]
Event.name: The Double Fine Adventure Adventure!

Event.description: 1v1, 32 Player Cap
Event.name: Beautiful Katamari Tournament

Event.description: Comedic superheroes unite! The Improv Initiative makes a return from PAX Prime to create improvised scenes and characters based off of audience suggestions. We’ll run through a variety of games and scenes in this one of a kind show, never to be performed the same way again! -- Panelists: Marc Watson [Customer Support Manager, Mojang AB], Greg Stackhouse [Associate Producer, Uber Entertainment], Tara Theoharis [Blogger - Geeky Hostess, Producer/Actor - Job Hunters], Graham Stark [Producer, Actor, LoadingReadyRun], Michael Robles [Community Manager, Wizards of the Coast]
Event.name: Improv Initiative 2

Event.description: At the dawn of the computer age, roleplaying games used text as the only way for a player to inhabit fantastic worlds. Players could fill in the gaps with their imagination, and this allowed early CRPGs to create a greater illusion of player choice by acting in the world. As computer graphics technology increased, developers could show more visuals to the player, and achievements in voice acting allowed for characters to truly come to life. But somehow, all the technical doodads restricted the player’s input because there are only so many permutations a game designer can cover. Now that technology has progressed even further, characters in games like Skyrim or the many MMOs out there should feel open to all kinds of player interactions, but NPC responses still come out bland and repetitive. Why can’t present games allow us to feel like we are playing in a vibrant, living world where our input has real impact on the story? When will games let us choose more than two or three options when talking to an NPC? This discussion between developers of today’s RPGs and MMOs will reveal what the next generation of computer role-playing games has in store. -- Panelists: Greg Tito [Senior Editor, The Escapist], Dave Georgeson [Sony Online Entertainment], Mike Laidlaw [BioWare], Ryan Dancey [Pathfinder Online]
Event.name: The Future of Playing a Role in Videogame RPGs

Event.description: Who invented dice? All we know for certain is he or she lived at least 5,000 years ago and was likely bored of throwing animal bones for fun. (Like Pass the Pigs except with real pig.) For some reason, Mr. or Ms. Paleo Gamer then started using cubes with dots on them. From there it was a short step to the modern 20 sided-dice. Wait, did I say modern? Because those were actually invented by the ancient Egyptians, as was the D12 - meaning they likely also invented D&D. Find out more about everyone’s favorite gaming essential, including the development (for reasons unknown) of the three, five and seven-sided die. If you’d like to find out how to make crooked dice, if you’re curious if it’s possible for someone to talk for an hour about dice or if you’re only other choice is a Dora The Explorer marathon, then this is the panel for you! -- Panelists: Constantine von Hoffman [Writer, CBSNews]
Event.name: A Random History of Dice

Event.description: Hobbies can come and go, but for many of us gaming goes beyond “Hobby.” Whether it’s moments in games you still recall decades later, the friends from your old Counter-Strike clan, or that convention D&D game that devolved into chaos, there is a reason we wear the name “Gamer” as a badge of honor. Join the Gamers With Jobs Conference Call crew along with guests Jeff Green (GFW Radio, Popcap) and Justin McElroy (Polygon, My Brother My Brother & Me) as they discuss what keeps the gaming fire alive even after years or decades. But it’s not all about the past, it’s about the hope of what to come, and the best of what gaming is right now. This is Why We Game. -- Panelists: Shawn Andrich [Co-Founder, Gamers With Jobs], Sean Sands [Co-Founder, Gamers With Jobs], Julian Murdoch [Podcaster, Gamers With Jobs], Cory Banks [Podcaster, Gamers With Jobs], Justin McElroy [Managing Editor, Polygon], Jeff Green [Director of Editorial and Social Media, PopCap Games]
Event.name: Gamers With Jobs—Why We Game

Event.description: Argue, debate and help us decide what the Top 25 games of this generation were, and win prizes along the way! -- Panelists: Casey Lynch [Editor-in-Chief, IGN], Greg Miller [Executive Editor, IGN], Daemon Hatfield [Senior Video Host and Editor, IGN], Mitch Dyer [Editor, IGN]
Event.name: IGN Presents: GameScoop! The Top 25 Games of the Generation

Event.description: Gearbox Software is back at PAX East in Boston! If you’ve made it to our panels before, you know you will not want to miss this one! This is your opportunity to get a behind the scenes look at Gearbox Software and all your favorite Gearbox games including Borderlands 2, and other amazing Gearbox franchises. And we can’t forget about all the never before seen reveals, huge exclusives and massive surprises! We are now in the Main Theater this year so more space for more fans! Come out and join us! -- Panelists: Randy Pitchford (CEO of Gearbox Software), Mikey Neumann (Chief Creative Champion at Gearbox Software), Anthony Burch (Lead Writer for Borderlands 2 at Gearbox Software), Paul Hellquist (Creative Director for Borderlands 2 at Gearbox Software)
Event.name: Inside Gearbox Software

Event.description: Whatever happens to the source code, development equipment and historical information from all of those videogames from the 1970’s & 1980’s? The American Classic Arcade Museum and our guests panelist will answer those questions, and describe the importance & value of preserving video game history. -- Panelists: Mike Stulir [American Classic Arcade Museum], Gary Vincent [American Classic Arcade Museum], John Anderson [Freelance Author]
Event.name: ACAM—Preserving Video Game History Panel

Event.description: Major news aggregators and discussion sites agree - US patent law, and software-related patents in particular, are out of control: a major computer company patented rounded corners; a retailer patented clicking once; and it’s not worth developing a product because you’ll get immediately get sued into oblivion by some troll. Find out why all these are wrong, as we talk about the popular myths and fallacies, why patents do spur innovation, and how you can use patent law to increase the value of your gaming company. Of course, patent law is not perfect, and we’ll also discuss why the current arguments for reform don’t work and what arguments might. -- Panelists: Daniel Rose [Patent Attorney, Foley & Lardner, LLP], John Lanza [Patent Attorney, Foley & Lardner, LLP], Adam Losey [Attorney and Educator, Foley & Lardner, LLP], Dave Walls [CEO and Developer, Funkitron, Inc.], Seth Goldstein [Engineering Manager, Harmonix Music], Additional panelists to be named
Event.name: Everything You’ve Heard About Patent Law is Wrong

Event.description: 1v1 Score Attack, 32 Player Cap
Event.name: Pac Man CE DX Tournament

Event.description: 3v3, 192 Player Cap
Event.name: Shootmania Tournament

Event.description: Women in gaming and “fake nerd girls” have become a topic of much debate recently. For every voice raised in favor of critically addressing the climate for women in gaming, a dozen more cry out in defensive, silencing backlash. This panel offers a discussion of these issues, not from the outside, but from the inside, bringing together five women from across the nerd community who have faced trolls and white knights and lived to tell their tales. The panel includes game designer Shoshana Kessock, The Mary Sue managing editor Susana Polo, cosplay model Stella Chuu, and sex educator/nerdlesque performer Iris Explosion. This panel will also discuss positive strategies to create a safer, more supportive community for women at cons and in the gaming community at large. Moderated by the founder of D20 Burlesque, Anja Keister. -- Panelists: Anja Keister [Co-producer & performer, D20 Burlesque], Shoshana Kessock [CEO, game designer, blogger, Phoenix Outlaw Productions], Iris Explosion [Sex Educator, freelance performer], Stella Chuu [Cosplay model, freelance performer & model], Susana Polo [Managing Editor, The Mary Sue]
Event.name: You Game Like A Girl: Tales of Trolls & White Knights

Event.description: DisorganizationXIII’s band of pro gamers and tournament organizers are here to talk about how to run a successful gaming tournament. They will cover organization, equipment, and even how to stream your tournament live over the internet. Learn how to bring together your local gaming community without losing your head in the inevitable chaos that is the tournament scene. Weeklies, majors, or just simple meetups, this panel will teach you how to prepare and run any size tournament effectively and smoothly. As a special bonus, we will be telling some of our own favorite tournament horror stories. Bring your own! (Panel will focus on fighting game tournaments but the concepts therein can apply to any game genre.) -- Panelists: Angelo D’Argenio [President/Editor/Editor, DisorganizationXIII/Shoryuken.com/Cheat Code Central], JP Porcaro [President, American Library Association’s Games and Gaming Round Table], Leah Davis [Senior Member, Disorganization XIII], Robert Bauer [Senior Member/Lead Educator, DisorganizationXIII/Mathnasium], Maximillian Krchmar [Tournament Organizer], Andrew Greenberg [Tournament Organizer, Team St1ckbug] Brandon Nance [Tournament Organizer]
Event.name: How to Run a Tournament: Bringing Together Your Local Community

Event.description: Gaming is not just a form of entertainment. Games are being used by top researchers for everything from disaster preparedness to cyber defense. So called “Serious Games” offer researchers the ability to explore complex decision processes, evaluate novel technologies, and assess player performance. Join MIT Lincoln Laboratory researchers for a conversation on serious games and their application to national security problems. -- Panelists: Andrew Weinert [Technical Staff, Disaster Preparedness, MIT Lincoln Laboratory], Adam Norige [Technical Staff, Homeland Protection, MIT Lincoln Laboratory], Erik Schlicht [Technical Staff, Cognitive Science, MIT Lincoln Laboratory], Andy Wang [Technical Staff, Decision Support, MIT Lincoln Laboratory], Nancy Crabtree [Technical Staff, Cyber Defense, MIT Lincoln Laboratory], Tim Dasey [Group Leader, Decision Support Technologies, MIT Lincoln Laboratory]
Event.name: Gaming in Support of National Security

Event.description: You love video game music in all sorts of styles? So do we!! Join the staff of VGM superfan community OC ReMix for MASSIVE LIVE PERFORMANCES, highlights of community projects (including the successfully Kickstarted album, Final Fantasy VI: Balance and Ruin - over $153,000 raised!!!), gaming competitions, trivia, prizes (limited edition physical albums!!!), and ALL THE VGM THINGS! -- Panelists: PLUS, get a load of the NEW version of the ocremix.org website! It’s HERE, and creator & designer David “djpretzel” Lloyd is gonna show off the goods! OC ReMix’s heavy hitters are also here in full force! Ask djpretzel, community manager Larry “Liontamer” Oji & the top artists of OCR your burning questions! DON’T MISS OUT! GET SWAGGED OUT!
Event.name: OC ReMix: Punching You in the FACE with VIDEO GAME MUSIC!!!

Event.description: Wait, they do even more panels!? These guys are the best! Come meet the hardest working duo in the online jpeg racket. Gabe and Tycho field your questions and entertain you because hey, you deserve it. -- Panelists: Gabe and Tycho!
Event.name: Penny Arcade Q&A #2

Event.description: Negotiation, leverage, seduction, persuasion, cooperation, vows and promises. Social conflicts don’t play out like sword fights, but here in tabletop roleplaying we often use similar systems for both. Join independent RPG designers Emily Care Boss, Epidiah Ravachol, Meguey Baker, and Vincent Baker for a crash course in designing systems for non-violent conflict and confrontation. -- Panelists: Vincent Baker [Owner/Creator, Lumpley Games], Meguey Baker [Owner/Creator, Night Sky Games], Emily Care Boss [Owner/Creator, Black & Green Games], Epidiah Ravachol [Owner/Creator, Dig a Thousand Holes Publishing]
Event.name: Sex and (Non)Violence

Event.description: 1v1, 32 Player Cap
Event.name: Virtual-On OT Tournament

Event.description: Playing pinball—isn’t that just slamming the buttons and hoping the ball goes in the right direction? NO! Two-time PAPA World Champion Bowen Kerins will teach you how to aim, how to nudge, how to control the ball, and how to strategically plan your way through a game. Bowen will play his way through live games of pinball while the action is captured and displayed via a camera mounted above the game. -- Panelists: Bowen Kerins [Pinball Player, Pro-Am Pinball Association], Mark Steinman [Coordinator, Pro-Am Pinball Association]
Event.name: How To Play Pinball

Event.description: Tired of using pringles cans and cut felt for your tabletop gaming? In this panel the crew that made the Corvis Warmachine table for Penny Arcade and the CEO of Tectonic Craft Studios will teach attendees the basics of tabletop terrain fabrication. Topics will include materials, methods, and sizes as well as tips and tricks. We will also present where the future of tabletop terrain is going with new maker technologies like personal laser cutters, CnCs, and rapid prototyping machines. -- Panelists: Mark Sivak [Co-Founder, At-Large Gamers], Richard Ranky [CEO, 3-Spark], Seth Sivak [CEO, Proletariat Inc.], Dan Cotrupe [Lead Designer and CEO, Tectonic Craft Studios]
Event.name: Tabletop Gaming Terrain 101: Learn to make terrain for your tabletop adventures

Event.description: Do you have to be a programmer to have a career in the gaming industry? Join James Lopez as he discusses alternative careers in the gaming industry with gamers who have taken their gaming passion and have created businesses around them. Learn what it takes to succeed in gaming, from some of the best creative minds in the industry. Bring your notepad and questions, leave with executable advice on how to take it to the next level. -- Panelists: James Lopez [Founder, ThePhatStartup.com], Anthony Frasier [Founder, TheKoalition.com], CJ Peters [Founder/CEO, KonsoleKingz.com], Gerard Williams [Founder, HipHopGamerShow.com], Alexis Hebert-Ruiz [Community Manager, Microsoft]
Event.name: Turning Your Gaming Passion Into Profits

Event.description: Would you like to play a game? The goal: be the funniest gamer in the room. Gather around the projector as some of the most twisted minds in the gaming industry, armed with hilarious video clips, partake in a King of the Hill battle for funniest moment in gaming. From unfortunate glitches to ugly nerd rages, it’s clip after clip of the things we find hilarious… and humanity is truly ashamed of. Who will take home this year’s “No Life. Whatsoever.” award in this classic game of “my video is funnier than yours”? The audience decides. -- Panelists: Seven DeBord [Creator, RaidWarning, GuildWarsInsider], Patrick Mulhern [Editor in Chief, Lorehound], Landon Robinson [Writer, Machinima]
Event.name: Clip War! Gaming’s Funniest Video Moments and Mishaps

Event.description: What’s the “Right” way to create a transgender character for a video game, and how do you make games more welcoming for transgender gamers? Our panel of transgender game designers and journalists will discuss and debate how Trans characters should be presented in games, and how the gaming industry and community can better address issues of inclusiveness. -- Panelists: Charles Battersby [Writer, www.DoEE.us], Jennell Jaquays [Owner, Dragongirl Studios], Rebecca Heineman [CEO, Olde Skuul], Eric L. Patterson [News Editor, EGM Media]
Event.name: Press XY Presents: Help, I think my Wizard is a Transsexual!

Event.description: Free to Play games have cropped up in almost every genre of gaming these days, and that’s good news for newbies and old-timers who want to relive the glory of their youth with revived franchises like MechWarrior, Tribes (Todd Harris is now onboard as of this edit!) and Star Citizen! Go back to the future with the developers of these free to play titles, join the discussion and win sweet prizes! -- Panelists: Russ Bullock [CEO, Lead Dev, MechWarrior Online, Piranha Games], Chris Roberts [President, Lead Dev, Star Citizen, Cloud Imperium Games], Todd Harris [President, Hi Rez (Tribes Ascend), Hi Rez Studios]
Event.name: Going Back To The Future - Calling All Mechwarriors, Tribes and Star Citizens

Event.description: Featuring the sports gaming writers from Polygon, Joystiq, GamesRadar, and Operation Sports, along with two developers with a long history of success in the sports game genre, the panel discusses the threats and opportunities sports fans face with the upcoming generation of consoles and tablets. -- Panelists: Richard Grisham [Panel Host, Operation Sports, GamesRadar], Mike Suszek [Weekend Editor, Joystiq], Samit Sarkar [News Reporter, Polygon], Kraig Kujawa [Creative Director, Iron Galaxy Studios], Greg Sewart [Associate Producer, Frontier Developments]
Event.name: Sports Gaming in the Next Generation

Event.description: eSports, Competitive Gaming, Professional Gaming. All terms for a worldwide community and movement spanning multiple games and genres since the mid-90’s. 2012 was the biggest year yet, but it’s been a long and bumpy road along the way. Join veterans Marcus “djWHEAT” Graham from TwitchTV alongside GameSpot’s Rod “Slasher” Breslau to learn the origins of esports, the current state of the industry, and what the future will bring. -- Panelists: Rod [Lead eSports Editor, Host, GameSpot, Live On Three], Marcus [eSports & Viz Dev Manager, Host, TwitchTV, Live On Three]
Event.name: eSports in 2013: The Past, Present, and Future

Event.description: Kids playing video games? We’re at a point of saturation - a 2010 (that’s 2 years ago, for those counting) Pew Internet & American Life poll showed that 99% of boys and 94% of girls play video games. Psychiatrically speaking, is this a bad thing? Can gaming be addicting? Are games safe for kids? How much is too much? How can we keep kids safe? Join Dr. Tyler Black, a frequent PAX presenter and a child psychiatrist from BC Children’s Hospital, to explore these issues. The panel will be a 40 minute presentation followed by interactive discussion. -- Panelists: Dr. Tyler R. Black [Child and Adolescent Psychiatrist, BC Children’s Hospital]
Event.name: Parenting and Video Games: The Psychiatric Perspective

Event.description: Dungeon Mastering, like wine tasting and equestrianism, is a fine art. It takes a variety of skills- story-weaver, actor, lawyer, arbitrator- to sit behind the screen with confidence, style and aplomb. But fear not. These skills can all be learned and our expert Dungeon Masters plucked straight from the D&D R&D department will be on hand to answer your questions. Need tips for DM’ing with D&D Next rules? Have some rules that need adjudication? Want help building encounters and campaigns? A Q&A session will follow the panel discussion. All levels of Dungeon Masters welcome. -- Panelists: Chris Perkins [Senior Producer, Wizards of the Coast], Mike Mearls [Senior Manager, Wizards of the Coast]
Event.name: The Art of the Dungeon Master

Event.description: Developers and journalists discuss and handicap the NAVGTR Awards races with last-minute predictions just hours before the winners are announced in each category, in one of the weekend’s final panels. -- Panelists: Moderated by Ken Gagne of PC World, guest panelists include Susan Arendt, editor-in-chief of The Escapist, Jesse Cox, co-host of the Gamestation podcast, Charles Battersby of Explosion.com, and Will Brierly of Snowrunner Productions and Soda Drinker Pro, downloaded by 10 million popheads.
Event.name: Will Win/Should Win: The NAVGTR Awards Debate

Event.description: Name your favorite games. Now name your favorite educational games. It’s hard, right? I mean, what kind of a nerd asks what your favorite educational games are? It’s not like any of them are, y’know, fun. Or educational. But it doesn’t have to be that way. There’s a lot of misunderstanding from teachers and developers alike on how to optimally use the potent force of gaming towards the betterment of society and the enrichment of the souls of the students. As a former middle school teacher and current developer of the Marxist macroeconomic game “Neocolonialism” (subalterngames.com), I want to change that. Let’s talk about it. -- Panelists: Seth Alter [Captain of Industry, Subaltern Games]
Event.name: Most Educational Games are Crap (but they don’t have to be)

Event.description: Last year we brought to you the national pastime of Canada, but in 2013… we can assure you the experience will be far more harrowing. ENJOY.
Event.name: Omegathon Final Round: ???
